channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Beechwood Road is rarely swept, 15th June
item.description:
This glass has been in this pavement for weeks. It’s the perfect illustration that the sweeper never actually sweeps Beechwood Road. I see him stood in corners on his phone, and walking past rubbish that needs sweeping.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Beechwood Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly-tipping next to rubbish bins, 15th June
item.description:
The black article (I don't know what it is) has been there for a few weeks, but this weekend a broken chair and wheelchair have appeared. The area is not lit at night and I'm assuming someone thinks this is their private tip. Please can someone remove these items before it gets out of hand?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Garrick Drive, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress is becoming part of the furniture, 15th June
item.description:
Mattress still here 3 weeks after report, don’t take too much longer otherwise I may grow an attachment to it

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hoskins Street, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Severely overgrown shrubs and bushes, 15th June
item.description:
Access to Lamorbey Park is being hindered due to lack of regular maintenance to the fence boundary from Burnt Oak Lane into the Park. This pathway is used by many people and is becoming more dangerous by the day
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Burnt Oak Lane, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
